intro: Microtis frutetorum, commonly known as the Orange-flowered Microtis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a cluster of narrow, linear leaves that are typically evergreen. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
